value: https://pray1962.web.app/assets/icon/pbsc.png
Anthem
*Title*
Text of the anthem
Morning Prayer
The Minister shall read aloud one or more of these Sentences of the Scriptures that follow.

value.text: Wherefore seeing we also are compassed about with so great a cloud of witnesses, let us lay aside every weight, and the sin which doth so easily beset us, and let us run with patience the race which is set before us, looking unto Jesus the author and finisher of our faith.

value: The Minister, turning to the people, shall say the Exhortation in the form following. Occasionally the second paragraph may be omitted.

Dearly beloved brethren, the Scripture moveth us in sundry places to acknowledge and confess our manifold sins and wickedness; and that we should not dissemble nor cloke them before the face of Almighty God our heavenly Father; but confess them with an humble, lowly, penitent, and obedient heart; to the end that we may obtain forgiveness of the same, by his infinite goodness and mercy.

And although we ought at all times humbly to acknowledge our sins before God; yet ought we most chiefly so to do, when we assemble and meet together to render thanks for the great benefits that we have received at his hands, to set forth his most worthy praise, to hear his most holy Word, and to ask those things which are requisite and necessary, as well for the body as the soul.
Wherefore I pray and beseech you, as many as are here present, to accompany me with a pure heart and humble voice unto the throne of the heavenly grace.
A general Confession to be said of the whole Congregation with the Minister, all kneeling.

Almighty and most merciful Father, We have erred and strayed from thy ways like lost sheep, We have followed too much the devices and desires of our own hearts, We have offended against thy holy laws, We have left undone those things which we ought to have done, And we have done those things which we ought not to have done; And there is no health in us. But thou, O Lord, have mercy upon us, miserable offenders. Spare thou them, O God, which confess their faults. Restore thou them that are penitent; According to thy promises declared unto mankind in Christ Jesu our Lord. And grant, O most merciful Father, for his sake, That we may hereafter live a godly, righteous, and sober life, To the glory of thy holy Name. Amen.

O LORD, we beseech thee, absolve thy people from their offences; that through thy bountiful goodness we may all be delivered from the bands of those sins, which by our frailty we have committed. Grant this, O heavenly Father, for Jesus Christ’s sake, our blessed Lord and Saviour. Amen.
Here the Lord’s Prayer may be said; the people repeating it with the Minister.

OUR Father who art in heaven, Hallowed be thy Name, Thy kingdom come, Thy will be done, on earth as it is in heaven. Give us this day our daily bread; And forgive us our trespasses, As we forgive them that trespass against us; And lead us not into temptation, But deliver us from evil. For thine is the kingdom, the power, and the glory, For ever and ever. Amen.

value.label: Minister.
value.text: O Lord, open thou our lips;

value.label: People.
value.text: And our mouth shall show forth thy praise.

value.label: Minister.
value.text: O God, make speed to save us;

value.label: People.
value.text: O Lord, make haste to help us.

value: Here, all standing up, the Minister shall say:

value.text: Glory be to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Ghost;

value.label: People.
value.text: As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be, world without end. Amen.

value.label: Minister.
value.text: Praise ye the Lord.

value.label: People.
value.text: The Lord’s Name be praised.

value: Then shall be said or sung this Psalm following; except on days for which Proper Anthems are provided. On the nineteenth day of the month, this Psalm shall be omitted in the ordinary course of the Psalms.
At the discretion of the Minister the last four verses may be omitted.
GLORY be to the Father, and to the Son, / and to the Holy Ghost;
As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be, / world without end. Amen.
The Lord is glorious in his Saints: / O come, let us worship.

value.verse: O COME, let us sing unto the LORD: /
value.halfverse: let us heartily rejoice in the strength of our salvation.

value.verse: Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving, /
value.halfverse: and show ourselves glad in him with psalms.

value.verse: For the LORD is a great God, /
value.halfverse: and a great King above all gods.

value.verse: In his hand are all the corners of the earth: /
value.halfverse: and the strength of the hills is his also.

value.verse: The sea is his, and he made it: /
value.halfverse: and his hands prepared the dry land.

value.verse: O COME, let us worship, and fall down, /
value.halfverse: and kneel before the LORD our Maker.

value.verse: For he is the Lord our God; /
value.halfverse: and we are the people of his pasture, and the sheep of his hand.

value.verse: TO-DAY, O that ye would hear his voice: /
value.halfverse: ‘Harden not your hearts as in the Provocation, and as in the day of Temptation in the wilderness;

value.verse: When your fathers tempted me, /
value.halfverse: proved me, and saw my works.

value.verse: Forty years long was I grieved with that generation, and said, /
value.halfverse: “It is a people that do err in their hearts, for they have not known my ways”;

value.verse: Unto whom I sware in my wrath, /
value.halfverse: that they should not enter into my rest.’

value: Then shall follow THE PSALMS.
GLORY be to the Father, and to the Son, / and to the Holy Ghost;
As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be, / world without end. Amen.

value.verse: BLESSED is the man that hath not walked in the counsel of the ungodly, nor stood in the way of sinners, /
value.halfverse: and hath not sat in the seat of the scornful.

value.verse: But his delight is in the law of the LORD; /
value.halfverse: and in his law doth he meditate day and night.

value.verse: And he shall be like a tree planted by the water-side, /
value.halfverse: that bringeth forth his fruit in due season,

value.verse: Whose leaf also doth not wither; /
value.halfverse: and look, whatsoever he doeth, it shall prosper.

value.verse: As for the ungodly, it is not so with them; /
value.halfverse: but they are like the chaff, which the wind scattereth away from the face of the earth.

value.verse: Therefore the ungodly shall not be able to stand in the judgement, /
value.halfverse: neither the sinners in the congregation of the righteous.

value.verse: For the LORD knoweth the way of the righteous; /
value.halfverse: but the way of the ungodly shall perish.

value: GLORY be to the Father, and to the Son, / and to the Holy Ghost;
As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be, / world without end. Amen.

value.verse: LORD, who shall dwell in thy tabernacle? /
value.halfverse: or who shall rest upon thy holy hill?

value.verse: EVEN he that leadeth an uncorrupt life, and doeth the thing which is right, /
value.halfverse: and speaketh the truth from his heart.

value.verse: He that hath used no deceit in his tongue, nor done evil to his neighbour, /
value.halfverse: and hath not slandered his neighbour.

value.verse: He in whose eyes an ungodly man is despised /
value.halfverse: but he maketh much of them that fear the LORD.

value.verse: He that sweareth unto his neighbour, and disappointeth him not, /
value.halfverse: though it were to his own hindrance.

value.verse: He that hath not given his money upon usury, /
value.halfverse: nor taken a bribe against the innocent.

value.verse: WHOSO doeth these things /
value.halfverse: shall never fall.

value: GLORY be to the Father, and to the Son, / and to the Holy Ghost;
As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be, / world without end. Amen.

value.verse: BLESSED is the man that feareth the LORD, /
value.halfverse: that hath great delight in his commandments.

value.verse: His seed shall be mighty upon earth; /
value.halfverse: the generation of the faithful shall be blessed.

value.verse: Riches and plenteousness shall be in his house; /
value.halfverse: and his righteousness endureth for ever.

value.verse: Unto the upright there ariseth up light in the darkness; /
value.halfverse: he is merciful, loving, and righteous.

value.verse: It is well with the man that is merciful and lendeth, /
value.halfverse: and ordereth his affairs with justice.

value.verse: For he shall never be moved: /
value.halfverse: and the righteous shall be had in everlasting remembrance

value.verse: He will not be afraid of any evil tidings; /
value.halfverse: for his heart standeth fast and believeth in the LORD.

value.verse: His heart is established and will not shrink, /
value.halfverse: until he see his desire upon his enemies.

value.verse: He hath dispersed abroad and given to the poor, /
value.halfverse: and his righteousness remaineth for ever; his horn shall be exalted with honour.

value.verse: The ungodly shall see it, and it shall grieve him: /
value.halfverse: he shall gnash with his teeth and consume away; the desire of the ungodly shall perish.

value: GLORY be to the Father, and to the Son, / and to the Holy Ghost;
As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be, / world without end. Amen.

value.verse: BLESSED is the man that hath not walked in the counsel of the ungodly, nor stood in the way of sinners, /
value.halfverse: and hath not sat in the seat of the scornful.

value.verse: But his delight is in the law of the LORD; /
value.halfverse: and in his law doth he meditate day and night.

value.verse: And he shall be like a tree planted by the water-side, /
value.halfverse: that bringeth forth his fruit in due season,

value.verse: Whose leaf also doth not wither; /
value.halfverse: and look, whatsoever he doeth, it shall prosper.

value.verse: As for the ungodly, it is not so with them; /
value.halfverse: but they are like the chaff, which the wind scattereth away from the face of the earth.

value.verse: Therefore the ungodly shall not be able to stand in the judgement, /
value.halfverse: neither the sinners in the congregation of the righteous.

value.verse: For the LORD knoweth the way of the righteous; /
value.halfverse: but the way of the ungodly shall perish.

value: GLORY be to the Father, and to the Son, / and to the Holy Ghost;
As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be, / world without end. Amen.

value.verse: WHY do the nations so furiously rage together, /
value.halfverse: and why do the peoples imagine a vain thing?

value.verse: The kings of the earth stand up, and the rulers take counsel together, /
value.halfverse: against the LORD, and against his anointed:

value.verse: ‘Let us break their bonds asunder, /
value.halfverse: and cast away their cords from us.’

value.verse: HE that dwelleth in heaven shall laugh them to scorn; /
value.halfverse: the Lord shall have them in derision.

value.verse: Then shall he speak unto them in his wrath, /
value.halfverse: and vex them in his sore displeasure:

value.verse: ‘Yet have I set my king /
value.halfverse: upon my holy hill of Sion.’

value.verse: I WILL tell of the decree of the LORD, wherein he hath said unto me, /
value.halfverse: ‘Thou art my son, this day have I begotten thee.

value.verse: Desire of me, and I shall give thee the nations for thine inheritance, /
value.halfverse: and the utmost parts of the earth for thy possession.

value.verse: Thou shalt bruise them with a rod of iron, /
value.halfverse: and break them in pieces like a potter’s vessel.’

value.verse: BE wise now therefore, O ye kings; /
value.halfverse: be warned, ye that are judges of the earth.

value.verse: Serve the LORD with fear, /
value.halfverse: and bow down unto him with reverence;

value.verse: Lest he be angry, and ye perish in the way; for his wrath is quickly kindled. /
value.halfverse: Blessed are all they that put their trust in him.

value: GLORY be to the Father, and to the Son, / and to the Holy Ghost;
As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be, / world without end. Amen.

value.verse: LORD, how are they increased that trouble me! /
value.halfverse: many are they that rise against me.

value.verse: Many there be that say of my soul, /
value.halfverse: ‘There is no help for him in his God.’

value.verse: BUT thou, O LORD, art my defender; /
value.halfverse: thou art my glory, and the lifter up of my head.

value.verse: I did call upon the LORD with my voice, /
value.halfverse: and he heard me out of his holy hill.

value.verse: I LAID me down and slept; /
value.halfverse: I rose up again, for the LORD sustained me.

value.verse: I will not be afraid for ten thousands of the people, /
value.halfverse: that have set themselves against me round about.

value.verse: UP, LORD, and help me, O my God, /
value.halfverse: for thou smitest all mine enemies upon the cheek; thou hast broken the teeth of the ungodly.

value.verse: Salvation belongeth unto the LORD; /
value.halfverse: let thy blessing be upon thy people.

value: GLORY be to the Father, and to the Son, / and to the Holy Ghost;
As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be, / world without end. Amen.

value.verse: HEAR me when I call, O God of my righteousness: /
value.halfverse: thou hast set me at liberty when I was in trouble; have mercy upon me, and hearken unto my prayer.

value.verse: O YE sons of men, how long will ye blaspheme mine honour, /
value.halfverse: and have such pleasure in vanity, and seek after falsehood?

value.verse: Know this also, that the LORD hath chosen to himself the man that is godly; /
value.halfverse: when I call upon the LORD, he will hear me.

value.verse: Stand in awe, and sin not; /
value.halfverse: commune with your own heart, and in your chamber, and be still.

value.verse: Offer the sacrifice of righteousness, /
value.halfverse: and put your trust in the LORD.

value.verse: THERE be many that say, ‘Who will show us any good?’ /
value.halfverse: LORD, lift thou up the light of thy countenance upon us.

value.verse: Thou hast put gladness in my heart, /
value.halfverse: more than men have when their grain and wine increase.

value.verse: I will lay me down in peace, and take my rest; /
value.halfverse: for it is thou, LORD, only, that makest me dwell in safety.

value: GLORY be to the Father, and to the Son, / and to the Holy Ghost;
As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be, / world without end. Amen.

value.verse: PONDER my words, O LORD; /
value.halfverse: consider my meditation.

value.verse: O hearken thou unto the voice of my calling, my King and my God; /
value.halfverse: for unto thee will I make my prayer.

value.verse: My voice shalt thou hear betimes, O LORD; /
value.halfverse: early in the morning will I direct my prayer unto thee, and will look up.

value.verse: FOR thou art the God that hath no pleasure in wickedness; /
value.halfverse: neither shall any evil dwell with thee.

value.verse: Such as are boastful shall not stand in thy sight; /
value.halfverse: for thou hatest all them that work iniquity.

value.verse: Thou shalt destroy them that speak lies; /
value.halfverse: the LORD abhorreth both the bloodthirsty and deceitful man.

value.verse: BUT as for me, I will come into thy house through the multitude of thy mercies; /
value.halfverse: and in thy fear will I worship toward thy holy temple.

value.verse: Lead me, O LORD, in thy righteousness, because of mine enemies; /
value.halfverse: make thy way plain before my face.

value.verse: FOR there is no faithfulness in their mouth; /
value.halfverse: their inward parts are very wickedness.

value.verse: Their throat is an open sepulchre; /
value.halfverse: they flatter with their tongue.

value.verse: Give sentence upon them, O God; /
value.halfverse: let them perish through their own imaginations:

value.verse: Cast them out in the multitude of their ungodliness; /
value.halfverse: for they have rebelled against thee.

value.verse: BUT let all them that put their trust in thee rejoice; /
value.halfverse: let them ever be giving of thanks, because thou defendest them; they that love thy Name shall be joyful in thee;

value.verse: For thou, LORD, wilt give thy blessing unto the righteous, /
value.halfverse: and with thy favourable kindness wilt thou defend him as with a shield.

value: Then shall be read THE FIRST LESSON as appointed, and before each Lesson the Minister shall say, The First [or Second] Lesson is written in such a book, in such a chapter, beginning at such a verse. And after the Lesson he shall say, Here endeth the First [or Second] Lesson.
The First Lesson is written in ${longName}, the ${chapter} chapter, beginning at the ${verse} verse.
The First Lesson is written in the Wisdom of Solomon, the 3rd chapter, beginning at the 1st verse.

value.text: But the souls of the righteous are in the hand of God, and there shall no torment touch them.
In the sight of the unwise they seemed to die: and their departure is taken for misery,
And their going from us to be utter destruction: but they are in peace.
For though they be punished in the sight of men, yet is their hope full of immortality.
And having been a little chastised, they shall be greatly rewarded: for God proved them, and found them worthy for himself.
As gold in the furnace hath he tried them, and received them as a burnt offering.
And in the time of their visitation they shall shine, and run to and fro like sparks among the stubble.
They shall judge the nations, and have dominion over the people, and their Lord shall reign for ever.
They that put their trust in him shall understand the truth: and such as be faithful in love shall abide with him: for grace and mercy is to his saints, and he hath care for his elect.

value: Here endeth the First Lesson.

After the First Lesson shall be sung or said the Hymn Te Deum Laudamus. But the Canticle Benedicite, Omnia Opera, page 26, is suitable of use in Advent, in Lent, on Ember Days (except those in Whitsun Week), on Rogation Days, and when the third chapter of Daniel is read as the First Lesson.
At the discretion of the Minister, the third section of Te Deum may be omitted.

Thou art the King of Glory, O Christ.
	Thou art the everlasting Son of the Father.
	When thou tookest upon thee to deliver man, thou didst not abhor the Virgin’s womb.
	When thou hadst overcome the sharpness of death, thou didst open the kingdom of heaven to all believers.
	Thou sittest at the right hand of God, in the glory of the Father.
	We believe that thou shalt come to be our Judge.
	We therefore pray thee, help thy servants, whom thou hast redeemed with thy precious blood.
	Make them to be numbered with thy Saints, in glory everlasting.

O LORD, save thy people, and bless thine heritage;
	Govern them, and lift them up for ever.
	Day by day we magnify thee;
	And we worship thy Name, ever world without end.
	Vouchsafe, O Lord, to keep us this day without sin.
	O Lord, have mercy upon us, have mercy upon us.
	O Lord, let thy mercy lighten upon us, as our trust is in thee.
	O Lord, in thee have I trusted: let me never be confounded.
value.label: TE DEUM LAUDAMUS.

value: Then shall be read in like manner THE SECOND LESSON as appointed; and after that the following Canticle, except when it forms part of the Gospel or Second Lesson appointed for the day.
The Second Lesson is written in ${longName}, the ${chapter} chapter, beginning at the ${verse} verse.
The Second Lesson is written in the Revelation to St. John the Divine, the 19th chapter, beginning at the 6th verse.

value.text: And I heard as it were the voice of a great multitude, and as the voice of many waters, and as the voice of mighty thunderings, saying, Alleluia: for the Lord God omnipotent reigneth.
Let us be glad and rejoice, and give honour to him: for the marriage of the Lamb is come, and his wife hath made herself ready.
And to her was granted that she should be arrayed in fine linen, clean and white: for the fine linen is the righteousness of saints.
And he saith unto me, Write, Blessed are they which are called unto the marriage supper of the Lamb. And he saith unto me, These are the true sayings of God.

And I fell at his feet to worship him. And he said unto me, See thou do it not: I am thy fellowservant, and of thy brethren that have the testimony of Jesus: worship God: for the testimony of Jesus is the spirit of prophecy.

value: Here endeth the Second Lesson.

value.halfverse: for he hath visited and redeemed his people;
value.verse: BLESSED be the Lord God of Israel; /
And hath raised up a mighty salvation for us, /
value.halfverse: in the house of his servant David;
which have been since the world began;
value.verse: As he spake by the mouth of his holy Prophets, /

value.halfverse: and from the hands of all that hate us;
value.verse: That we should be saved from our enemies, /

value.halfverse: and to remember his holy covenant;
value.verse: To perform the mercy promised to our forefathers, /

value.halfverse: that he would grant us
value.verse: To perform the oath which he sware to our forefather Abraham, /
That we being delivered out of the hands of our enemies /
value.halfverse: might serve him without fear,

value.verse: In holiness and righteousness before him, /
value.halfverse: all the days of our life.
for thou shalt go before the face of the Lord to prepare his ways;
value.verse: AND thou, child, shalt be called the Prophet of the Highest: /

value.halfverse: for the remission of their sins;
value.verse: To give knowledge of salvation unto his people /

value.halfverse: whereby the day-spring from on high hath visited us;
value.verse: Through the tender mercy of our God; /

value.halfverse: and to guide our feet into the way of peace.
value.verse: To give light to them that sit in darkness, and in the shadow of death, /

value: GLORY be to the Father, and to the Son, / and to the Holy Ghost;
As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be, / world without end. Amen.
GLORY be to the Father, and to the Son, / and to the Holy Ghost;
As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be, / world without end. Amen.

value.verse: O BE joyful in the LORD, all ye lands: /
value.halfverse: serve the LORD with gladness, and come before his presence with a song.

value.verse: Be ye sure that the LORD he is God; /
value.halfverse: it is he that hath made us, and not we ourselves; we are his people, and the sheep of his pasture.

value.verse: O go your way into his gates with thanksgiving, and into his courts with praise; /
value.halfverse: be thankful unto him, and speak good of his Name.

value.verse: For the LORD is gracious, his mercy is everlasting; /
value.halfverse: and his truth endureth from generation to generation.

value: Then shall be said or sung the Confession of the Faith, called the Apostles’ Creed.

I BELIEVE in God the Father Almighty, Maker of heaven and earth:
	And in Jesus Christ his only Son our Lord, Who was conceived by the Holy Ghost, Born of the Virgin Mary, Suffered under Pontius Pilate, Was crucified, dead, and buried: He descended into hell; The third day he rose again from the dead; He ascended into heaven, And sitteth on the right hand of God the Father Almighty; From thence he shall come to judge the quick and the dead.
	I believe in the Holy Ghost; The holy Catholic Church; The Communion of Saints; The Forgiveness of sins; The Resurrection of the body, And the Life everlasting. Amen.
And after the Creed these prayers following, all devoutly kneeling, the Minister first pronouncing:

value.text: The Lord be with you;

value.label: People.
value.text: And with thy spirit.

value.label: Minister.
value.text: Let us pray.
Lord, have mercy upon us.
Lord, have mercy upon us.

value: OUR Father who art in heaven, Hallowed be thy Name, Thy kingdom come, Thy will be done, on earth as it is in heaven. Give us this day our daily bread; And forgive us our trespasses, As we forgive them that trespass against us; And lead us not into temptation, But deliver us from evil. Amen.
Then the Priest standing up shall say:

value.text: O Lord, show thy mercy upon us;

value.label: People.
value.text: And grant us thy salvation.

value.label: Priest.
value.text: O Lord, save the Queen;

value.label: People.
value.text: And mercifully hear us when we call upon thee.

value.label: Priest.
value.text: Endue thy Ministers with righteousness;

value.label: People.
value.text: And make thy chosen people joyful.

value.label: Priest.
value.text: O Lord, save thy people;

value.label: People.
value.text: And bless thine inheritance.

value.label: Priest.
value.text: Give peace in our time, O Lord;

value.label: People.
value.text: And evermore mightily defend us.

value.label: Priest.
value.text: O God, make clean our hearts within us;

value.label: People.
value.text: And take not thy Holy Spirit from us.

value: Then shall follow THE COLLECT OF THE DAY, together with any other Collects appointed to be said, and these two prayers in order.

value.label: The Collect of the Day
value: O ALMIGHTY God, who hast knit together thine elect in one communion and fellowship, in the mystical body of thy Son Christ our Lord: Grant us grace so to follow thy blessed Saints in all virtuous and godly living, that we may come to those unspeakable joys, which thou hast prepared for them that unfeignedly love thee; through Jesus Christ our Lord.

O GOD, who art the author of peace and lover of concord, in knowledge of whom standeth our eternal life, whose service is perfect freedom: Defend us thy humble servants in all assaults of our enemies; that we, surely trusting in thy defence, may not fear the power of any adversaries; through the might of Jesus Christ our Lord.
value.label: The Second Collect, for Peace.

value: O LORD our heavenly Father, Almighty and everlasting God, who hast safely brought us to the beginning of this day: Defend us in the same with thy mighty power; and grant that this day we fall into no sin, neither run into any kind of danger; but that all our doings may be ordered by thy governance, to do always that is righteous in thy sight; through Jesus Christ our Lord.
value.label: The Third Collect, for Grace.

value: Here may follow an Anthem or an Hymn.
Then shall be read one of the Prayers for the Queen, and the Prayer for the Clergy and People.

O LORD our heavenly Father, high and mighty, King of kings, Lord of lords, the only Ruler of princes, who dost from thy throne behold all the dwellers upon earth: Most heartily we beseech thee with thy favour to behold our most gracious Sovereign Lady, Queen ELIZABETH; and so replenish her with the grace of thy Holy Spirit, that she may alway incline to thy will, and walk in thy way: Endue her plenteously with heavenly gifts; grant her in health and wealth long to live; strengthen her that she may vanquish and overcome all her enemies, and finally after this life she may attain everlasting joy and felicity; through Jesus Christ our Lord.
value.label: A Prayer for the Queen’s Majesty.

value: ALMIGHTY and everlasting God, from whom cometh every good and perfect gift: Send down upon our Bishops and Clergy, and all Congregations committed to their charge, the healthful Spirit of thy grace; and that they may truly please thee, pour upon them the continual dew of thy blessing. Grant this, O Lord, for the honour of our Advocate and Mediator, Jesus Christ.
value.label: A Prayer for the Clergy and People.

value: Then may be read any of the Occasional Prayers or Thanksgivings, or any prayers sanctioned by the Ordinary, always ending with the Prayer of St Chrysostom and the Grace; and before any of the prayers may be said Let us pray for —, and before any of the thanksgivings, Let us give thanks for —.

O GOD, the Creator and Preserver of all mankind, we humbly beseech thee for all sorts and conditions of men; that thou wouldest be pleased to make thy ways known unto them, thy saving health unto all nations. More especially we pray for the good estate of the Catholic Church; that it may be so guided and governed by thy good Spirit, that all who profess and call themselves Christians may be led into the way of truth, and hold the faith in unity of spirit, in the bond of peace, and in righteousness of life. Finally we commend to thy fatherly goodness all those, who are any ways afflicted or distressed in mind, body, or estate; [* %especially those for whom our prayers are desired;%] that it may please thee to comfort and relieve them, according to their several necessities, giving them patience under their sufferings, and a happy issue out of all their afflictions. And this we beg for Jesus Christ his sake.
value.label: A Prayer for all Conditions of men.

value: ALMIGHTY God, Father of all mercies, We thine unworthy servants do give thee most humble and hearty thanks For all thy goodness and loving-kindness To us and to all men; [* %particularly to those who desire now to offer up their praises and thanksgivings.%] We bless thee for our creation, preservation, and all the blessings of this life; But above all for thine inestimable love In the redemption of the world by our Lord Jesus Christ; For the means of grace, And for the hope of glory. And we beseech thee, give us that due sense of all thy mercies, That our hearts may be unfeignedly thankful, And that we show forth thy praise, Not only with our lips, but in our lives; By giving up ourselves to thy service, And by walking before thee in holiness and righteousness all our days; Through Jesus Christ our Lord, To whom, with thee and the Holy Ghost, be all honour and glory, world without end. Amen.
value.label: A General Thanksgiving

value: ALMIGHTY God, who hast given us grace at this time with one accord to make our common supplications unto thee; and dost promise that when two or three are gathered together in thy Name thou wilt grant their requests: Fulfil now, O Lord, the desires and petitions of thy servants, as may be most expedient for them; granting us in this world knowledge of thy truth, and in the world to come life everlasting.
value.label: A Prayer of Saint Chrysostom.

value.text: THE grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, and the love of God, and the fellowship of the Holy Ghost, be with us all evermore.
